intro: Terebinthus aptera, commonly known as the smooth terebinth, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers followed by small, woody fruits containing three seeds. It is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its resin has historically been used in traditional medicine and as a source of turpentine.
